div.div: κρατευταί : explained by Aristarchus as head-stones, on which the spits were rested in roasting meat; cf. our ‘fire - dogs,’ ‘andirons.’ Possibly the shape was like the horns (κέρας) on the altar in cut No. 95. Il. 9.214†.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
